intro: Stisseria radiata, commonly known as the radiate stisseria, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Stisseria radiata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for ecological studies and ornamental gardening.
